info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 8:28PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN MORRIS...SUSSEX... WARREN...NORTH CENTRAL LEHIGH...CARBON...MONROE AND NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 826 PM EST, an area of heavy snow was reported over the northern Lehigh Valley, southern Poconos and northern New Jersey. Snowfall rates of 1 to 3.5 inches per hour have been reported. Periods of heavy snowfall will continue for the next few hours, with 1 to 3 inch per hour rates possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Newton, Lehighton, Montague, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Hopatcong, Forks, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Hackettstown, Tobyhanna, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Mount Arlington, and Franklin. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 66 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 73 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 278 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 29. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Icy roads are likely with periods of visibility down to as low as one quarter of a mile.
